indicators.label: Total population
indicators.subtitle: Mid-year estimate of the total number of people
indicators.longDescription: This indicator shows the mid-year estimate of the total population, in the United Kingdom, for 1991 to 2024.
indicators.caveats: Population estimates in Explore Local Statistics (ELS) are informed by those available on Nomis at the time of publication on ELS.

indicators.label: Total female population
indicators.subtitle: Mid-year estimate of the total number of females
indicators.longDescription: This indicator shows the mid-year estimate of the total female population, in the United Kingdom, for 1991 to 2024.
indicators.caveats: Population estimates in Explore Local Statistics (ELS) are informed by those available on Nomis at the time of publication on ELS.

indicators.label: Total male population
indicators.subtitle: Mid-year estimate of the total number of males
indicators.longDescription: This indicator shows the mid-year estimate of the total male population, in the United Kingdom, for 1991 to 2024.
indicators.caveats: Population estimates in Explore Local Statistics (ELS) are informed by those available on Nomis at the time of publication on ELS.

indicators.label: Median age
indicators.subtitle: Median age of people
indicators.longDescription: This indicator shows the median age of people, in the United Kingdom, for 1991 to 2024.
indicators.caveats:
Median age is calculated as the age category in which the mid-point of the population distribution falls. There may be slight differences when compared with other sources, as these may reflect where the mid-point falls within the given age category. These reflect differences in precision, not accuracy.

Population estimates in Explore Local Statistics (ELS) are informed by those available on Nomis at the time of publication on ELS.

indicators.label: Female median age
indicators.subtitle: Median age of the female population
indicators.longDescription: This indicator shows the median age of the female population, in the United Kingdom, for 1991 to 2024.
indicators.caveats:
Median age is calculated as the age category in which the mid-point of the population distribution falls. There may be slight differences when compared with other sources, as these may reflect where the mid-point falls within the given age category. These reflect differences in precision, not accuracy.

Population estimates in Explore Local Statistics (ELS) are informed by those available on Nomis at the time of publication on ELS.

indicators.label: Male median age
indicators.subtitle: Median age of the male population
indicators.longDescription: This indicator shows the median age of the male population, in the United Kingdom, for 1991 to 2024.
indicators.caveats:
Median age is calculated as the age category in which the mid-point of the population distribution falls. There may be slight differences when compared with other sources, as these may reflect where the mid-point falls within the given age category. These reflect differences in precision, not accuracy.

Population estimates in Explore Local Statistics (ELS) are informed by those available on Nomis at the time of publication on ELS.

indicators.label: Population density
indicators.subtitle: Number of people resident per square kilometre
indicators.longDescription: This indicator shows the number of usual residents per square kilometre, calculated based on total land area excluding inland water, in the United Kingdom, for 1991 to 2024.
indicators.caveats:
[Standard Area Measurements (December 2024) in the UK](https://geoportal.statistics.gov.uk/datasets/ons::standard-area-measurements-for-the-local-authority-districts-december-2024-in-the-united-kingdom/about) was used to calculate population density by dividing the total population by the area in square kilometres.

Population estimates in Explore Local Statistics (ELS) are informed by those available on Nomis at the time of publication on ELS.

indicators.label: Female population density
indicators.subtitle: Number of females resident per square kilometre
indicators.longDescription: This indicator shows the number of usual female residents per square kilometre, calculated based on total land area excluding inland water, in the United Kingdom, for 1991 to 2024.
indicators.caveats:
[Standard Area Measurements (December 2024) in the UK](https://geoportal.statistics.gov.uk/datasets/ons::standard-area-measurements-for-the-local-authority-districts-december-2024-in-the-united-kingdom/about) was used to calculate population density by dividing the female population by the area in square kilometres.

Population estimates in Explore Local Statistics (ELS) are informed by those available on Nomis at the time of publication on ELS.

indicators.label: Male population density
indicators.subtitle: Number of males resident per square kilometre
indicators.longDescription: This indicator shows the number of usual male residents per square kilometre, calculated based on total land area excluding inland water, in the United Kingdom, for 1991 to 2024.
indicators.caveats:
[Standard Area Measurements (December 2024) in the UK](https://geoportal.statistics.gov.uk/datasets/ons::standard-area-measurements-for-the-local-authority-districts-december-2024-in-the-united-kingdom/about) was used to calculate population density by dividing the male population by the area in square kilometres.

Population estimates in Explore Local Statistics (ELS) are informed by those available on Nomis at the time of publication on ELS.

indicators.label: Five-year population change
indicators.subtitle: Percentage growth or decline over a five-year period
indicators.longDescription: This indicator shows the five-year percentage change in population, in the United Kingdom, for 1996 to 2024.
indicators.caveats: Population estimates in Explore Local Statistics (ELS) are informed by those available on Nomis at the time of publication on ELS.
